segment.source: UEFI Installation Media Format and default boot behavior
segment.target: UEFI Installation Media Format and default boot behavior

segment.source: UEFI Installation Media Format and default boot behavior
segment.target: UEFI Installation Media Format and default boot behavior

segment.source: UEFI Installation Media Format and default boot behavior
segment.target: UEFI Installation Media Format and default boot behavior

segment.source: This section describes the installation media formats and default boot behavior for UEFI platforms.
segment.target: This section describes the installation media formats and default boot behavior for UEFI platforms.

segment.source: Installation media guidelines
segment.target: Installation media guidelines

segment.source: Windows installation media supports boot on both BIOS and UEFI platforms by taking advantage of multi-entry El Torito boot catalog support.
segment.target: Windows installation media supports boot on both BIOS and UEFI platforms by taking advantage of multi-entry El Torito boot catalog support.

segment.source: The default El Torito boot entry is a BIOS entry that includes the 80x86 Platform ID, which is defined as “0x00” in hexadecimal.
segment.target: The default El Torito boot entry is a BIOS entry that includes the 80x86 Platform ID, which is defined as “0x00” in hexadecimal.

segment.source: The second El Torito boot entry is an EFI entry that includes the Platform ID as “0xEF” in hexadecimal.
segment.target: The second El Torito boot entry is an EFI entry that includes the Platform ID as “0xEF” in hexadecimal.

segment.source: The entry references a FAT partition that contains the bootable EFI application at EFIBOOTBOOTX64.EFI.
segment.target: The entry references a FAT partition that contains the bootable EFI application at EFIBOOTBOOTX64.EFI.

segment.source: Default boot behavior
segment.target: Default boot behavior

segment.source: Firmware vendors must ensure that the following conditions exist:
segment.target: Firmware vendors must ensure that the following conditions exist:

segment.source: The BIOS ignores boot entries that do not have the 80x86 Platform ID, which is defined as “0x00” in hexadecimal.
segment.target: The BIOS ignores boot entries that do not have the 80x86 Platform ID, which is defined as “0x00” in hexadecimal.

segment.source: Failure to ignore other boot entries results in the display of a confusing boot menu to the end user.
segment.target: Failure to ignore other boot entries results in the display of a confusing boot menu to the end user.

segment.source: The BIOS boots based on the BIOS entry without prompt.
segment.target: The BIOS boots based on the BIOS entry without prompt.

segment.source: The UEFI boot manager ignores boot entries that do not have the “0xEF” Platform ID.
segment.target: The UEFI boot manager ignores boot entries that do not have the “0xEF” Platform ID.

segment.source: The UEFI boot manager boots based on the EFI entry without prompt.
segment.target: The UEFI boot manager boots based on the EFI entry without prompt.

segment.source: To support the ability to boot from DVD media, the Windows installation DVD contains many El Torito boot entries that enable boot from either BIOS or UEFI.
segment.target: To support the ability to boot from DVD media, the Windows installation DVD contains many El Torito boot entries that enable boot from either BIOS or UEFI.

segment.source: The default El Torito boot entry is for BIOS.
segment.target: The default El Torito boot entry is for BIOS.

segment.source: Windows supports the “Non-removable Media Boot Behavior” section from the UEFI 2.3 specification.
segment.target: Windows supports the “Non-removable Media Boot Behavior” section from the UEFI 2.3 specification.

segment.source: During Windows installation and when updates are required for bootmgfw.efi, Windows copies the Windows boot application from efimicrosoft bootbootmgfw.efi to efibootboot{arch}.efi on the EFI system partition.
segment.target: During Windows installation and when updates are required for bootmgfw.efi, Windows copies the Windows boot application from efimicrosoft bootbootmgfw.efi to efibootboot{arch}.efi on the EFI system partition.

segment.source: This copy enables a default boot option for Windows if a nonvolatile RAM (NVRAM) boot entry is not available, such as when a hard disk is moved from one platform to another.
segment.target: This copy enables a default boot option for Windows if a nonvolatile RAM (NVRAM) boot entry is not available, such as when a hard disk is moved from one platform to another.

segment.source: When upgrading Windows, Windows preserves the existing boot order.
segment.target: When upgrading Windows, Windows preserves the existing boot order.

segment.source: When you perform a clean install of Windows, Windows updates the boot order so that it's the first boot entry in the list.
segment.target: When you perform a clean install of Windows, Windows updates the boot order so that it's the first boot entry in the list.

segment.source: Other media information
segment.target: Other media information

segment.source: The following additional guidelines apply for boot media:
segment.target: The following additional guidelines apply for boot media:

segment.source: Windows supports both CD and DVD boot from the Universal Disk Format (UDF) file system.
segment.target: Windows supports both CD and DVD boot from the Universal Disk Format (UDF) file system.

segment.source: Windows installation media also uses El Torito and is built by using the UDF bridge format to support both ISO 9660 and UDF version 1.02 file systems.
segment.target: Windows installation media also uses El Torito and is built by using the UDF bridge format to support both ISO 9660 and UDF version 1.02 file systems.

segment.source: The Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) includes an updated version of Oscdimg.exe that supports the creation of a multi-entry El Torito boot catalog.
segment.target: The Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) includes an updated version of Oscdimg.exe that supports the creation of a multi-entry El Torito boot catalog.
